Message.Title: Yahoo is the worst performer since Earnings Report
Message.Msg: Shares of YHOO are down 7,9% since its last earnings release Shares of GOOG are up 3% since its last earnings release Shares of AAPL are down 4% since its last earnings release Shares of FB are down 3,7% since its last earnings release

Message.Title: Federal court rules Obama's actions unconstitutional
Message.Msg: President Barack Obama violated the Constitution when he bypassed the Senate to fill vacancies on a labor relations panel, a federal appeals court panel ruled Friday. A three-judge panel of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit said that Obama did not have the power to make three recess appointments last year to the National Labor Relations Board. The unanimous decision is an embarrassing setback for the president, who made the appointments after Senate Republicans spent months blocking his choices for an agency they contended was biased in favor of unions.

Message.Title: How Much Should You Pay For Yahoo?
Message.Msg: According to my 5-year discounted-earnings-plus-book-value model, the fair-value range for Yahoo is between $18.50 and $30.85 per share. At a price of about $19.76, Yahoo is trading close to the lower boundary of its fair value range. The stock still has up to 56% upside potential to reach its fair value maximum.

Topic.Title: yhoo net value....

Message.Msg: Why do you feel the core is worth $10 or $12B at 1.2B shares still? Why would anyone pay a premium on "good management" that is so good that people are asking for a buyout and "growth" that is non-existent? The core is broken up into 3 parts: investment, search, display ads. Which of the 3 was the most profitable...INVESTMENTS at $676M if I remember right. The other 2 for fiscal 2012 was an operating income of $566M, a 29% decline from 2011.(slide 6). Their revenue has been stagnant and their operating margin has been 12% for the past 3yrs. Why would anyone pay 2.5X the revenue when growth has stalled and its most profitable thing is investments? Maybe $5-$6 per share and that is only if MSFT can fire everyone and double profits. Yahoo realistically is an ETF of China and Japan with a core thrown in.

Topic.Title: yhoo net value....

Message.Msg: Weird you didn't discuss ANYTHING I said or you said earlier. You didn't explain anything!!! Yes, good management is crucial but if a company isn't growing revenues on pace with online advertising can you really say its good management?lol What vision??? The investment side is in liquidation mode and you don't give a premium to what is effectively cash. You can't have both saying the AG and Yahoo Japan is worth $20 per share than want the core to be worth such and such when its separate. Sell AG and Yahoo Japan there goes that $676M. You want some moron to pay $12B+ on something that makes half a billion. Hate to tell ya but no acquirer is going to wait 26yrs to breakeven. Why do you want a buyout if Yahoo is so wonderful? Yahoo ISN'T growing period as revenue went to $4.987B from $4.984B or something. $500M+ operating profit at a 10PE only makes a $5B+ core. You say Yahoo is so wonderful yet you want a buyout? You're only lying to yourself apparently.

Topic.Title: eBay & Yahoo hook-up? Article

Message.Msg: The tech deal that intrigues me though is a possible purchase of Yahoo (YHOO) by eBay. Yahoo's new search is powerful, and frankly cool, but without a nudge, might never live up to its potential. Yahoo's homepage is still very popular — it's my homepage so it must be (haha) — and could be a fantastic way to integrate the businesses. Adding a more integrated eBay module and better developing Yahoo's social reach using the email system as the starting point, could provide incredible development opportunity for a company with broader scope.

Message.Title: Who will be the new CEO of Alibaba Group? Soon to be bigger than Amazon and Walmart combined
Message.Msg: Jack Ma, who has been CEO of Chinese ecommerce giant Alibaba Group for the past 14 years (since it was founded in 1999), will step down on May 10 2013. Alibaba's new CEO will be announced that day. Who will be the new CEO of the most powerful ecommerce company in the world? Coldone? Yahoo owns 24%...

Message.Msg: There is a strong rationale for Ebay to be concerned if YHOO decided to partner with Alibaba in US business operations. I think there is a desire from Alibaba (Jack Ma) to partner with Ebay.
